sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a regular polygon.
message_1: A regular polygon has 10 sides and each side measures 5cm. What is the perimeter of the polygon?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of a regular polygon, you can multiply the number of sides by the length of each side. In this case, the polygon has 10 sides, and each side measures 5 cm.

Perimeter = (Number of sides) × (Length of each side)
Perimeter = 10 × 5 cm
Perimeter = 50 cm

The perimeter of the polygon is 50 cm.
